p: DPPH · radical (2,2-diphenyl-1-pirylhydrazyl) and ABTS + (azino-bis (3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid) methods were used to evaluate the antioxidant activity (AA) of the olive oils. The DPPH · was done as described by Brand-Williams et al. [ 40], and the ABTS + as described by Re et al. [ 41] using a UV–visible spectrophotometer (Helios Gamma model, UVG 1002E; Helios, Cambridge, UK). Calibration curves (3.5–5.0 mmol Trolox L −1) with good linearity (R 2 ≥ 0.999) were used for the quantification of the AA by both methods. Analyses were run in triplicate, and the results were expressed as mmol Trolox L −1 of olive oil.
